Voices from the Perch

I've been waiting nine months for my bail decree."

— Crowbert Frost, Defendant & Poet

⚖ Mandatory Legal Verse

By Corvid Code, Section 9, Verse 3,
all text upon this site must rhyme, you see.
If any line should fail to find its pair,
the author shall be fined one beak of hair.

This website is the property of CAJA,
unauthorized access? Don't be a bothah.
All rights reserved, all wrongs adjudicated,
all launches postponed, all cats accommodated.

For questions, file a writ in couplet form,
or caw three times into the nearest storm.
Response times vary. (The cat is on the fax.)
Please pay your shiny object tax.

THE COURT FINDS:

The defendant is guilty of being too round,
the evidence was there but could not be found,
because the cat was sleeping on exhibit A,
court is adjourned. We'll try another day.

THIS VERDICT IS NON-BINDING (cat was on the binding)
